label: H5N1
description: Commonly known as Avian Influenza H5N1. A severe bird flu virus that can occasionally infect humans. It's a major concern for both animal and public health, requiring careful monitoring and swift action when detected.

label: H5N2
description: Commonly known as Avian Influenza H5N2. Another bird flu virus, generally less dangerous to humans than H5N1. It can still cause significant problems for poultry farms and wild bird populations.

label: H7N2
description: Commonly known as Avian Influenza H7N2. A milder form of bird flu. While it mainly affects birds, it can sometimes spread to humans who work closely with infected poultry, but usually causes only mild symptoms.

label: H7N8
description: Commonly known as Avian Influenza H7N8. A less common bird flu virus. We're still learning about its effects, but it's important to monitor as part of our overall disease surveillance efforts.
